author: Anonymous Comp
title: pset 4 error with template tag for next-ball function
question:
If we're expected to change the signature for the next-ball function to allow for any number of balls in the program, how is that the original template tag for next-ball can't be changed?? (I know it says we're not supposed to change ANYTHING about next-ball, but when I handed it in to autograder the first time I lost marks on the signature & template tag)
    0%  of   100%  x Stopped grading because part of starter file was changed or reordered.  Can't find (@template Number) in its proper sequence in the file.
I'm really confused, I actually got the program running properly, but it's just autograder issues that I need to fix...I would greatly appreciate any hints!
student_answer:
don't change next-ball at all lol simple as that
there's a way to have an arbitrary number of balls without changing next-ball
if you can't change next-ball, what could you do instead?
